title: Blog Content Guidelines
description: Guidelines for creating and formatting blog content for this site.

body.raw:
# Blog Content Guidelines

This directory contains all the blog posts for the site, written in MDX format.

## Writing a New Post

1. Create a new `.mdx` file in this directory with a descriptive name (e.g., `my-new-post.mdx`)
2. Add the required frontmatter at the top of the file:

```md
---
title: "Your Post Title"
date: "YYYY-MM-DD"
description: "A short description of your post (150-160 characters)"
cover: "/images/blog/your-image.jpg"
tags: ["tag1", "tag2", "tag3"]
published: true
---
```

3. Write your content in Markdown format below the frontmatter
4. Add any images to the `public/images/blog/` directory
5. Preview your post by running `npm run dev` and visiting `/blog/my-new-post`

## Frontmatter Fields

| Field         | Description                                                    | Required              |
| ------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------- |
| `title`       | The title of your post                                         | Yes                   |
| `date`        | Publication date in YYYY-MM-DD format                          | Yes                   |
| `description` | A short summary of your post                                   | Yes                   |
| `cover`       | Path to the cover image (should be in `public/images/blog/`)   | No                    |
| `tags`        | Array of tags for categorization                               | No                    |
| `published`   | Boolean to control visibility (unpublished posts won't appear) | No (defaults to true) |

## Markdown Features

The blog supports standard Markdown syntax plus:

- Code syntax highlighting
- Math equations
- Tables
- Images
- Embedded React components

## Example

```md
---
title: "Getting Started with Next.js"
date: "2025-04-15"
description: "Learn how to build modern web applications with Next.js"
cover: "/images/blog/nextjs-cover.jpg"
tags: ["nextjs", "react", "tutorial"]
published: true
---

# Introduction to Next.js

Next.js is a React framework that provides...

## Key Features

- Server-side rendering
- Static site generation
- API routes
```

Happy writing!
